clinical_study.brief_title: MSSA and MRSA Screening in Patients Undergoing Elective TJA: the Benefits of Next-generation Sequencing
clinical_study.official_title: MSSA and MRSA Screening in Patients Undergoing Elective TJA: the Benefits of Next-generation Sequencing

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of this study were to evaluate the diagnostic performance of molecular and culture techniques in S. aureus screening using paired nasal and groin swabs, to determine, if any, discrepancy between the diagnostic techniques and to model the potential effect of different diagnostic techniques on S. aureus detection in orthopaedic patients

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic techniques to identify S. aureus in total joint replacement patients
primary_outcome.description: to model the potential effect of different diagnostic techniques on S. aureus detection in orthopaedic patients.

intervention.description: diagnostic performance of molecular and culture techniques in S. aureus screening using paired nasal and groin swabs, to determine, if any, discrepancy between the diagnostic techniques on S. aureus detection in orthopaedic patients

study_pop.textblock: All patients undergoing primary total knee or total hip arthroplasty at our institution will be eligible

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients undergoing primary total knee or total hip arthroplasty at our institution will be eligible.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients included in other prospective studies
